org.jay3d.engine.core.components

Class PointLight

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jay3d.engine.core.components.GameComponent
      • org.jay3d.engine.core.components.BaseLight
        • org.jay3d.engine.core.components.PointLight
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpotLight

    public class PointLight
extends BaseLight
    PointLight is a child class of BaseLight, which uses attenuation on top of colour and intensity. As there isn't a convenience class for colour as of yet, Vector3f is being used instead for the meantime. Vector3f(float x, float y, float z)

    BaseLight's colour like so: Colour(RBG) float x = R float y = G float z = B

    Example: PointLight(new Vector3f(1, 1, 1), 1.0f, new Attenuation(0, 0, 1) Returns a PointLight that is white with an intensity of 1.0f and Attenuation with constant and linear values 0 but exponential value of 1.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PointLight

        public PointLight(Vector3f colour,
                  float intensity,
                  Attenuation attenuation)
        Constructs and initialises a PointLight specified colour, intensity and attenuation. Within the constructor, the object's range is calculated and has it's shader is automatically set to Forward-point.vs and Forward-point.fs. Therefore requires the shaders in order to work.
        Parameters:
        colour - The Point Light's colour (RGB)
        intensity - The Point Light's intensity
        attenuation - The Attenuation(float constant, float linear, float exponent)
